New Records: Oklahoma City Thunder extended their NBA record by winning their seventh straight to open the season by at least 12 or more points.
The Thunder allowed 86 points, setting a new season low.
Key Match Events: Jalen Williams scored 23 points on 10-for-17 shooting, including three 3-pointers, adding three steals and four rebounds.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander tallied 21 points, nine assists, six rebounds and a game-high +20 plus-minus, though he committed a season-high four turnovers.
Chet Holmgren recorded 14 points, nine rebounds and two blocks.
The Thunder's defense forced Orlando into 35.4% shooting overall and 14.7% from downtown.
The Magic struggled with outside shooting, making only 1-for-17 from deep in the first half.
Pre-Game Insights: Without injured starters Paolo Banchero and Wendell Carter Jr., the Magic started their fourth different group of the year.
Oklahoma City put together their best offensive quarter in the year to start the game, scoring 39 first-quarter points on 15-for-21 (71.4%) shooting.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder's defense was praised for forcing Orlando into poor shooting percentages.
The game highlighted the Thunder's strong start to the season with a 7-0 record.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chet Holmgren did not return after checking out with 4:53 remaining in the third quarter due to an awkward landing after a putback dunk.
Without injured starters, the Magic started a new lineup for the fourth time in the season.
